title: [CASSANDRA-17126] Removing usages of java.io.File and others from tests
body:
Replaced the usages of java.io.File, java.io.FileInputStream, java.io.FileOutputStream, java.io.FileWriter and java.io.RandomAccessFile from tests.

Could not find alternative to RandomAccessFile.setLength(), so added checkstyle exceptions.

CASSANDRA-17241: Improve audit logging documentation for production
body:
After using audit logging in production, it turns out that documentation is lacking some important information.

Namely:
- roll_cycle can be overriden by Chronicle Queue
- max_log_size is ignored if archive_command option is set
- archive_command prevents Chronicle Queue Shrink Manager from working

title: CASSANDRA-17226: Consistency Level Considered Connectivity Checker
body:
This commit introduces two main features:

1. The ability to provide a custom implementation of the `StartupConnectivityChecker`
2. The `ConsistencyLevelStartupConnectivityChecker` checker

In `cassandra.yaml`, a custom implementation of the `StartupConnectivityChecker` can be
specified by providing the fully qualified class name by setting the `startup_connectivity_checker`
property in the yaml file. Additionally, the property supports the existing implementation
of the checker: `StrictStartupConnectivityChecker` (the default); and a new implementation
of the checker called the `ConsistencyLevelStartupConnectivityChecker`.

The current implementation of the `StartupConnectivityChecker` (the default) ensures that
all-but-one peers in each datacenter are available during Cassandra startup. We call this
implementation the strict implementation (`StrictStartupConnectivityChecker`). It is a
strict implemetation because it requires all-but-one of the peers are available during
cluster startup.

The Consistency Level Considered implementation of the checker borrows the concept of the
`ConsistencyLevel` to determine the number of peer connections required during startup.
The lowest non-zero replication factor among all user keyspaces is used to determine the
quorum.

The checker breaks the check into 2 phases:
1. In phase one, it checks if the primary set of peers has connected.
2. In phase two, if primary peers have not yet responded then it sends additional ping messages
   to the rest of the peers and checks if the connected peers can satisfy the specified
   consistency level.

The checker supports the following values for `ConsistencyLevel`:

- ALL: all peers are required for the checks
- QUORUM: primary peers required for quorum are used for the checks
- LOCAL_QUORUM: primary peers in the local DC required for local quorum are used for the checks
- EACH_QUORUM: quorum in each DC is required for the primary peers

The default consistency level is `LOCAL_QUORUM` and this value can be configured in
`cassandra.yaml` by specifying the `block_for_peers_consistency_level` property. The
checker reuses the original `block_for_peers_timeout_in_secs` property to determine
how long the node will wait to connect to other peers.

The cheker only supports the `NetworkTopologyStrategy`. The checker is not suitable
when using vnodes.

Co-authored-by: Yifan Cai <yifan_cai@apple.com>

title: CASSANDRA-17235 Add diagnostic events for unavailable errors
CASSANDRA-17210: Remove unused port parameter from sstableloader documentation
body: The sstableloader documentation states that the native transport port can be specified using the `--port` parameter, but this parameter is not actually used in the code. The intended effect is achieved by specifying the port on the host address instead, which this PR intends to clarify.

CASSANDRA-15215 Use DataOutputPlus.writeBytes in VIntCoding.writeUnsignedVInt
body:
In the cases where VInt occupies less than or equal to 8 bytes
and the underlying buffer has at least 8 bytes, VIntCoding writes the
entire register in a single operation and then adjusts the buffer position.

CASSANDRA-17159 Log queries that fail on timeout or unavailable errors up to once per minute by default
body: While unavailable exceptions and timeouts are logged at ERROR generically in `JVMStabilityInspector#uncaughtException()`, we don't actually get anything related to the failing _query_ in the logs. This patch addresses that, and makes sure that we don't spam the logs in the process.

title: Cassandra 17138 trunk
Paxos: in-progress-ballot needs to be set while accepting a proposal
body:
I was going through this blog post (thanks for @martinfowler for pointing me to this post)
, which talks about a bug in paxos implementation if in-progress ballot is not set while accepting a proposal.
https://brooker.co.za/blog/2021/11/16/paxos.html

I tried writing a failing test and possible fix. Will like to get comments.

modify alter statements with IF EXISTS and IF NOT EXISTS
body:
#### Adding IF EXISTS and IF NOT EXISTS to the following:
* ALTER TABLE IF EXISTS myTable ...
* ALTER TABLE myTable ADD IF NOT EXISTS ...
* ALTER TABLE myTable  IF EXISTS ADD IF NOT EXISTS ...
* ALTER TABLE myTable DROP IF EXISTS ...
* ALTER TYPE IF EXISTS myType ...
* ALTER TYPE myType ADD IF NOT EXISTS 
* ALTER KEYSPACE IF EXISTS

WIP:
* ALTER ROLE
* ALTER MATERIALIZED VIEW
* ALTER USER

#### Update:
Added alter statements to role, materialized view and user.

Newer Java hides sun.rmi.registry.RegistryImpl and interface is fully implemented anyway
body: Newer java versions appear to hide sun.rmi.registry.RegistryImpl, and thus cause compile error.  However, since the interface is fully implemented here (mostly stubs), I couldn't find a reason not to simply derive from the interface directly.

title: CASSANDRA-6936: Byte-comparable API
body:
Provides an API for converting all values of types that can be used in
primary keys to byte sequences that can be compared lexicographically
by unsigned byte value (i.e. byte-comparable sequences) and back.

title: [CASSANDRA-17065] Support settings for entire SSTable outbound streaming
body:
This commit adds support for entire SSTable outbound streaming and entire SSTable
outbound streaming between datacenters. The new configuration options are:

- `entire_sstable_stream_throughput_outbound_megabits_per_sec` for internal throttling, and
- `entire_sstable_inter_dc_stream_throughput_outbound_megabits_per_sec` for inter-DC throttling.

Additionally, `nodetool` support is added in this commit as well to set entire SSTable
outbound streaming settings. For example, to set the entire SSTable outbound streaming
to 1200 Mbps, new command-line flags (`-esst`, `--set-entire-sstable-throughput`,
`--print-entire-sstable-throughput`) are introduced:

```bash
nodetool setstreamthroughput -esst 1200
nodetool setstreamthroughput --set-entire-sstable-throughput 1200
```

To print the entire SSTable outbound streaming settings, the flag can also be used like this:

```bash
nodetool getstreamthroughput -esst
nodetool getstreamthroughput --print-entire-sstable-throughput
```

The same flags are supported for `nodetool`'s `setinterdcstreamthroughput` and
`getinterdcstreamthroughput` operations.

This commit also introduces an optimization when entire SSTable throttling is disabled.
The optimization uses netty's `DefaultFileRegion` to flush to the channel, as opposed to
the `SharedFileChannel` implementation, which uses the `RateLimiter` for the transfer.

title: CASSANDRA-17047(trunk): Fix queries for DROP column when schema propagation takes time
CASSANDRA-17047(4.0):  Fix queries for DROP column when schema propagation takes time
body: The patch ensure that even when a node is not aware of a DROP column it will answer correctly to the query by taking into account only the {{fetched}} columns requested by the coordinatoor.

title: CASSANDRA-17047(3.11): Handle unexpected columns due to drop column schema races
body: The patch ensure that even when a node is not aware of a DROP column it will answer correctly to the query by taking into account only the fetched columns requested by the coordinatoor.
